image.altText: Two women smile at the camera while in line for fresh fruit in front of rows of produce

props.synopsis: As Australian households struggle with cost of living, charities are feeling the pressure — with food relief services in particular saying demand has never been greater.

title.children: Food spending is being crunched by the cost of living, and households are at the coalface

image.altText: Police standing in a reserve.

props.synopsis: A young teenage boy has been rushed to hospital with critical injuries after he was hit in the head during a hammer-throwing accident at Clearview.

title.children: Teen rushed to hospital in critical condition after serious sporting accident

image.altText: Tyson Stinger runs off in celebration of a goal with teammates

props.synopsis: Geelong produces an inspired qualifying final display, beating Port Adelaide by 84 points to earn the right to host a preliminary final.

title.children: Power failure 'not easy to explain' for Hinkley as sensational Cats advance to prelim in style

image.altText: A young woman with long brown hair

props.synopsis: Mother of three Synamin Bell was killed by her former partner Cody James Edwards in her Millicent home while he was in a drug-induced psychosis in 2022.

title.children: Family of SA mother killed by partner leaves court before perpetrator can deliver apology

image.altText: A man in agricultural attire leans on a tractor.

props.synopsis: Winter crop production is forecast to rise to near-record levels in parts of the country but farmers in others are hoping just to break even after battling unfavourable weather.

title.children: Crops flourish in eastern states while South Australia, Victoria face harvest slump

image.altText: A white whale calf in on the surface of the ocean.

props.synopsis: It's been an exceptional whale season off the coast of South Australia, where the return of southern rights after a mysterious absence last year is being celebrated by enthusiasts.

title.children: 'Magical' southern right whales return to SA coast with rare white calves in tow

image.altText: A man standing at a lectern, spreading his arms and shrugging.

props.synopsis: Bill Shorten has had an enormous impact on the NDIS. When he leaves parliament next year, there will be no shortage of challenges for whoever steps in as minister, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

title.children: Bill Shorten is leaving politics. The next NDIS minister better be ready to roll up their sleeves

image.altText: A woman hold a photo of her son.

props.synopsis: The governor-general will soon receive the final report of the Royal Commission into Defence and Veterans Suicide. Grieving families are hoping it will lead to lasting change.

title.children: '3,000 veterans dead': This grieving mother has led the fight for all of them

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Chris Minns Jacinta Allan, prime minister in focus.

props.synopsis: The federal government calls on the states and territories to step up efforts to reduce domestic, sexual and family violence, ahead of more funds being delivered to address the issue.

title.children: Federal government calls out states for missed DV staffing targets ahead of anticipated $351m support package

image.altText: A couple hold hands with a child with the family court building in the background.

props.synopsis: Family violence perpetrators are routinely granted time with their children during custody proceedings, but a world-renowned expert hopes to change the culture of "mother blaming" he says has permeated the agencies dealing with family violence.

title.children: 'We need to have higher expectations for men as parents': Family violence expert reveals the myths and biases that unravel family court cases

image.altText: Side profiles of Vincent Tarzia and David Speirs shrouded in dark shadows

props.synopsis: Former South Australian Liberal leader David Speirs has not held back in his assessment both of his successor's fledgling leadership and his party's chances at the next state election, saying there is a "level of shambolic-ness about what's going on".

title.children: 'Shambolic-ness' besets SA Liberal Party less than a month after new leader appointed, David Speirs says

image.altText: A woman in a purple top sits in front of a coloured wall.

props.synopsis: A suburb in Adelaide's north has pockets of intergenerational disadvantage but its community is working together to improve outcomes for local children.

title.children: Children can be on a specialist waitlist for months. This school is helping parents access care

image.altText: Vanessa Low of Australia in action, competing in the long jump at the Paris Paralympics

props.synopsis: Defending champion Vanessa Low has broken her own world record with the first jump of the women's long jump T63 final. Follow live.

title.children: Low breaks world record to claim long jump title, Hodge and Parker win gold medals for Australia

image.altText: A black and white scanning electron microscope image showing half a kidney stone with lots of craggles and unevenness

props.synopsis: Kidney stones are an annoying, painful condition that affects many of us, but it's not easy to tell when they form. A scientist who carbon dates objects for a living decided to work out the age of his kidney stone.

title.children: 'Please save it for me': Scientist carbon dates his own kidney stone to find out when it formed

image.altText: The Pope holding a paper while sitting on a chair next to the Indonesian president

props.synopsis: Pope Francis's modesty leaves a strong impression on many Indonesians during his visit – highlighting a stark contrast to the lavish lifestyle often displayed by the country's officials and public figures.

title.children: As the pope visited Indonesia, the manner of his arrival drew as much attention as his words

image.altText: Patchy snow slope with mounds of dirt dotted through it

props.synopsis: Tourism operators and the broader Snowy Mountains region are looking to summer tourism options as they face the prospect of warmer winters and shorter ski seasons.

title.children: This year's ski season ended far earlier than usual, prompting soul-searching among operators

image.altText: Mitch Duke holds his hands to his face

props.synopsis: A 10-man Socceroos outfit has suffered a shock 1-0 loss to Bahrain on the Gold Coast in a disastrous setback to their hopes of direct World Cup qualification.

title.children: Bahrain mark maiden win over Australia as Socceroos suffer shock World Cup qualifier loss

image.altText: An old letterbox with pasture-less land prepared for timber plantation rows behind

props.synopsis: Residents say a "corrosive" trend to sell fertile farmland to make way for foreign-owned wood plantations is ruining communities and threatening Australia's food security.

title.children: Why farms in Australia's most valuable dairy region are being sold to foreign timber companies

image.altText: A Liberal Party corflute at a polling booth

props.synopsis: Liberals have had to bring in the big guns to deal with the party's hot mess.

title.children: Dutton tries to fix the Liberals' hot mess — but not without first making it worse

image.altText: Rebecca Cheptegei running on a road, with a crowd of onlookers lining the footpath.

props.synopsis: Ugandan Olympic marathon runner Rebecca Cheptegei has died, days after she was doused in petrol and set on fire by her boyfriend.

title.children: Ugandan Olympic marathon runner Rebecca Cheptegei dies after attack from partner

image.altText: Liam Gallagher leans with an arm slung over his brother Noel's shoulder.

props.synopsis: Uber, Qantas, Virgin and more all use price surging to help their ticket prices match demand. It's a completely legal practice, and Live Nation says it plans to roll it out for concert tickets here in Australia.

title.children: Thanks to Oasis, dynamic pricing has come under fresh scrutiny in the UK. Live Nation says Australia is next

image.altText: Two samples of fluoride salt as a solid and as a liquid.

props.synopsis: China plans to build the world's first-ever nuclear power station using molten salt as the fuel carrier and coolant, and thorium as the fuel — revealed in a since-deleted report posted on the Shanghai Institute of Applied Physics website.

title.children: China to build first-ever thorium molten salt nuclear power station in Gobi Desert

image.altText: A man standing in a park

props.synopsis: A witness has told the South Australian Supreme Court that Steven Hainsworth tried to sell her items from an alleged victim's home, and allegedly made an admission to killing a man. Warning: This story contains graphic details.

title.children: Alleged serial killer stole and sold victim's belongings, court hears

image.altText: Sheep in a pen on Kangaroo Island.

props.synopsis: Millions of sterile male blowflies will be bred at a world-first facility and released to mate with females in a trial aiming to end flystrike on the island.

title.children: Hopes painful pest costing sheep farmers millions could soon be eradicated on Kangaroo Island

image.altText: Leader of the Opposition Peter Dutton arrives for Question Time

props.synopsis: The Coalition scare campaign says the next election will deliver a Labor minority government — propped up by an unholy alliance of Greens and teal independents — and that it will be chaos. But does that stack up?

title.children: Dutton has a maths problem that a scare campaign can't solve

image.altText: A man at a cash register.

props.synopsis: With freight adding up to 50 per cent to their cost of living, Lord Howe Islanders find ways to manage the price of living in paradise.

title.children: With petrol $4 a litre and rice $9 a kilo, Lord Howe island residents get creative to keep costs down

image.altText: A dozen King Island Dairy double brie cheese wheels splayed with their labels showing.

props.synopsis: The iconic King Island Dairy will close after more than 120 years of operations following dairy giant Saputo's failure to attract a buyer for the business.

title.children: King Island Dairy to shut, ending iconic Australian cheese brand

image.altText: A man with a hat and beard, and a woman with glasses sitting next to each other looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Indigenous elders who were successful in their bid to protect a culturally important site from a proposed gold mine say they have been slandered.

title.children: 'Threatened, harassed': Aboriginal elders break silence on Regis mine protection order

image.altText: A group of Japanese defence soldiers on the ground

props.synopsis: Japanese troops could join US marines for regular rotations through the Top End as Tokyo, Washington and Canberra continue to deepen defence and strategic ties in the face of China's swelling military might.

title.children: Japan, US and Australia forge closer military ties in face of China's growing influence

image.altText: Mount Isa

props.synopsis: As Mount Isa grapples with one of the highest crime rates in Queensland and more than 1,000 imminent job losses, local leaders want a prison to be built in their backyard.

title.children: Call for new outback prison to bridge gap between crime and rehabilitation

image.altText: A poster of Israeli hostage Eliya Cohen smiling with the words 'Bring him home now' is sticky taped to a wall with graffiti

props.synopsis: As the bodies of six Israeli hostages are recovered from Gaza, questions surround the status of those who remain captive nearly a year since the October 7 attack.

title.children: What we know about the remaining Hamas hostages

image.altText: Michel Barnier holding a microphone in front of a blue and black background.

props.synopsis: President Emmanuel Macron named the European Union's former Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier as France's new prime minister on Thursday.

title.children: Emmanuel Macron names EU former Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier as France's new prime minister

image.altText: Several police officers stand around in front of their police vehicles.

props.synopsis: The man was fatally injured in the exchanging of fire with police, but there was no indication anyone else was hurt.

title.children: Police shoot man dead after exchanging fire with him outside Israeli Consulate in Munich, Germany

image.altText: A Māori woman wearing a green plant crown and a feather necklace

props.synopsis: Kiingi Tuheitia Pootatau Te Wherowhero VII is laid to rest alongside generations of ancestors at Mount Taupiri after his funeral procession wraps up days of mourning.

title.children: After the death of the Māori king, his youngest child and only daughter is crowned as the new monarch
